shifts.title: shift 01: chip supply → power supply
shifts.subtitle: the energy wall
shifts.context: without energy infrastructure, ai deployment stalls. before agents, reasoning, or discovery - we need power.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Data centers demand more power than grids can supply.
machineCol.desc: ai demand for data center power projected to grow **160% by 2030**. demand for compute is growing faster than power grid capacity. the physical grid cannot be built fast enough to support ai expansion. the focus shifts from raw compute to **intelligence per watt** as the critical metric. more compute doesn't equal more value if it can't be powered. data centers are reopening coal plants and demanding nuclear reactors.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Every AI query consumes water and generates CO2.
humanCol.desc: **guilt computing** - users face the reality that complex reasoning has a physical toll. every ai query consumes water and generates co2. the disconnect between "green ai" corporate promises and "greed ai" reality.

gap.title: mind the gap
gap.desc: the disconnect between infinite "digital ideas" and hard "physical matter". while we imagine a billion agents, we cannot power them. The gap between business desire to deploy AI everywhere and the planet's physical inability to support it.

researchTop.title: IEA Energy and AI
researchTop.description: Data center electricity projected 536 TWh (2025) → 945-1,065 TWh (2030)

researchTop.title: McKinsey Cost of Compute
researchTop.description: 125 GW incremental capacity needed by 2030, $5.2-7.9T CapEx required

researchTop.title: Goldman Sachs AI Power Demand
researchTop.description: 165% increase in data center power demand by 2030

research.title: Reuters Peaker Plants
research.description: Obsolete peaker power plants forced back into service for AI

research.title: Snorkel AI Intelligence per Watt
research.description: New efficiency metric - intelligence delivered per unit of energy

research.title: IT Brief Grid Bottleneck
research.description: Physical grid cannot be built fast enough to support AI expansion

research.title: Goldman Sachs Fossil Fuel Reality
research.description: 60% of increased demand met by fossil fuels, adding 220M tons CO2 annually

shifts.title: shift 02: copilot → autonomous coworker
shifts.subtitle: the displacement (agentic labor)
shifts.context: once energy infrastructure stabilizes, models can scale. smarter models become agents.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Agents receive wallets, tools, and execute workflows.
machineCol.desc:
**agentic enterprise** - ai transitions from "assistant" to "autonomous coworker". agents receive **wallets** (x402 protocol), **tools** (mcp), and "hr for ai".

**service-as-software** - saas model shifts to agents that execute complete workflows. from selling "software licenses" to "executed outcomes".

the klarna benchmark: one ai assistant replaced **700 full-time agents**, slashed resolution time (11m → 2m), drove $40m profit, and achieved 25% fewer repeat inquiries than humans.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Humans shift from manual work to verifying AI work.
humanCol.desc:
**identity crisis** - "if an agent can do my job, who am i?". the psychological toll of moving from "creator" to "manager of agents".

**managerial drift** - humans lose the ability to do the work themselves, becoming dependent on agents they don't fully understand.

gap.title: the agency gap
gap.desc: the delay between technological replacement and social adaptation. companies deploy agents faster than society can define new roles for humans.

stats.desc: Cost to replace a human with an agent

researchTop.title: Anthropic Model Context Protocol
researchTop.description: Universal standard for AI data access adopted by OpenAI, Google, Microsoft

researchTop.title: Linux Foundation AAIF
researchTop.description: Agentic AI Foundation - 97M+ monthly SDK downloads

researchTop.title: x402 Protocol
researchTop.description: Internet-native payments protocol enabling autonomous AI agents

researchTop.title: a16z Service-as-Software
researchTop.description: Business model shift from software licenses to executed outcomes

research.title: MIT Sloan/BCG Agentic Enterprise
research.description: 76% of executives view AI as coworker not tool

research.title: Amazon Q Developer Case Study
research.description: 4,500 developer-years saved, $260M infrastructure savings, 79% auto-generated code accepted

research.title: DeepLearning.AI Agentic Workflows
research.description: Andrew Ng on transition from assistants to autonomous agents

research.title: LangChain Cognitive Architectures
research.description: Framework patterns for agent reasoning and decision-making

research.title: Josh Bersin Hiring for AI
research.description: Emergence of AI talent management as new HR discipline

aimEvidence.title: Intention OS
aimEvidence.description: Mike Yan's framework for managing attention when context explodes. Agentic workflow for context engineering.

aimEvidence.title: Founder OS YouTube Playlist
aimEvidence.description: Mental health firewalls and sovereign workflows for founders navigating AI transformation.

voices.text: from 'ai as smart assistant' to 'ai as full participant in the process'
voices.author: Yakov Vasiliev, AI Strategy × Product Architecture

voices.text: business coach → ai chatbot developer. "vibe-coded prototypes, shipped in 30 minutes what stalled 1.5 months
voices.author: Natalya Savenkova, Project Lead → Product Automation

shifts.title: shift 03: global openness → fragmented stacks
shifts.subtitle: the sovereignty (the splinternet)
shifts.context: when agents touch money, institutions demand rules. agentic labor makes AI a strategic asset.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Geopolitical fragmentation ends universal AI.
machineCol.desc:
geopolitical fragmentation - the end of "global ai". three distinct stacks emerge: **us ai** (corporate/closed - openai, anthropic), **china ai** (state-controlled - deepseek bypassing us norms), **eu ai** (regulated - ai act compliance).

agi is now a national security asset on "war footing".

**eu ai act** - first comprehensive ai regulation. creates **regulatory gap**: eu ai is "safe but slow", us/china ai is "dangerous but fast".

the **copyright war** - nyt lawsuit alleges models memorize and regurgitate copyrighted content verbatim. the case determines if human culture belongs to creators or model weights.

meta's "pay or consent" model in eu: pay €13/month or surrender to tracking.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Privacy becomes a luxury.
humanCol.desc:
**the guerrilla stack** - employees bring their own ai to bypass corporate limitations and censorship. **shadow ai adoption** - people use personal tools because corporate ai is blocked or neutered.

**privacy inequality** - privacy officially becomes a **luxury good**. "privacy is for the rich" - if you can't pay, you are the product.

**data sovereignty movement** - users demand "opt-out" rights - ability to prohibit training on their data. rise of "personal rag" and local-first architectures.

privacy becomes status – not secrecy, but control.

gap.title: the sovereignty gap
gap.desc: as ai becomes "aligned" to corporate/national values, you are talking to a constitutional filter. you lose objective context for a "safe narrative".

researchTop.title: EU AI Act
researchTop.description: First comprehensive AI regulation framework, full applicability August 2026

researchTop.title: Stanford HAI AI Index 2025
researchTop.description: 233 AI incidents in 2024 (+56% YoY growth)

researchTop.title: McKinsey Sovereign AI
researchTop.description: Europe's sovereign infrastructure strategy to compete with US/China

researchTop.title: Pew Research Trust Survey
researchTop.description: Cross-regional variance in AI trust and regulatory preferences

research.title: NYT vs OpenAI Lawsuit
research.description: Copyright battle determining if human culture belongs to creators or model weights

research.title: DeepSeek Open-Source
research.description: Chinese open-source models bypassing US export controls

research.title: Forbes BYOAI Movement
research.description: Employees bypassing corporate AI restrictions with personal tools

research.title: WebAI Local-First AI
research.description: Private drafting, smaller circles, local storage, intentional friction against performative posting

shifts.title: shift 04: chatbots (system 1) → thinking models (system 2)
shifts.subtitle: the reasoning
shifts.context: foundation layer complete. AI transitions from instinctive responses to deliberate thought. sequoia's act two.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: AI shifts from instinct to deliberate reasoning.
machineCol.desc:
the fundamental shift from "act 1" (probabilistic token prediction — chatgpt era) to **act 2** (reasoning and inference-time compute — o1 era).

**system 1 vs system 2 architecture** - transition from fast, instinctive responses to slow, deliberate, multi-step logical reasoning. models use **chain of thought** (cot) and **STaR** via reinforcement learning to "think" before answering.

**test-time compute** - models spend more compute during inference to reason through problems. trading speed for accuracy.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Auditing machine logic becomes human work.
humanCol.desc:
**auditable work** - users no longer trust "magic" speed. they demand to see the **reasoning trace**: the chain of thought that led to the conclusion. transparency over velocity.

**logic auditor role** - human value shifts from execution to verifying machine logic. we become auditors of ai reasoning paths.

**reasoning reliability gap** - **48% of reasoning tasks** still produce errors in complex scenarios. reasoning models haven't eliminated hallucinations - they've made them more convincing.

gap.title: the metabolisation gap
gap.desc: a model processes 1,000 reasoning steps in seconds; a human follows five. this leads to meaning dilution: we accept conclusions because auditing the path is too exhausting.

stats.desc: Error rate in complex reasoning tasks

researchTop.title: Li et al. Reasoning LLMs Survey
researchTop.description: Comprehensive survey of reasoning capabilities in large language models

researchTop.title: STaR Self-Taught Reasoner
researchTop.description: Foundational paper on using reinforcement learning to make models "think" before answering

researchTop.title: OpenAI o3 Benchmark
researchTop.description: 83% human-level reasoning (ARC-AGI), 71.7% on SWE-bench Verified

research.title: OpenAI SWE-bench Verified
research.description: o3 scores 71.7% on verified software engineering benchmarks

research.title: Korra $67B AI Hallucination Warning
research.description: Global enterprise losses from AI hallucinations

research.title: All About AI Hallucination Statistics
research.description: 4.3 hours weekly spent fact-checking AI output, 48% error rate in complex reasoning

shifts.title: shift 05: information hoarding → context filtering
shifts.subtitle: the knowledge (memory)
shifts.context: reasoning models can't think in vacuum. they need maximum context - enterprise data, docs, conversations.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Context windows explode from 8k to 1M+ tokens.
machineCol.desc:
**enterprise RAG** - retrieval-augmented generation becomes standard. "chat with pdf" is dead. models access all company data simultaneously via vector databases and semantic search.

**MCP (model context protocol)** - anthropic's "usb port for ai". universal standard for connecting models to data sources. models plug into slack, notion, github, databases.

**1M token windows** - claude 3.7, gemini 2.0 flash can process millions of tokens. context windows explode from 8k to 1M+ tokens.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Context obesity: consuming more than can be metabolized.
humanCol.desc:
**context obesity** - "you're not burned out, you have context obesity." consuming more information than can be metabolized into meaning. burnout is working memory overflow.

**context collapse** - personal, professional, and public contexts blur. ai extracts your words from context and feeds them to models across boundaries.

**curation crisis** - employees spend **30% of work time** searching for internal information. knowledge access isn't the problem - knowledge discovery and curation are.

gap.title: the context gap
gap.desc: 1M token windows vs. human limit (7 items). we have too much information but zero insight. context collapse blurs professional and private life.

stats.desc: Annual financial risk from unmanaged context/hallucinations
Work time lost to internal search
Model context window vs 7 items human working memory limit

researchTop.title: Anthropic Model Context Protocol
researchTop.description: Universal standard adopted by OpenAI, Google, Microsoft within 13 months

researchTop.title: Gartner Top 10 Strategic Trends 2025
researchTop.description: 40% of apps will have agentic AI by 2026

researchTop.title: Microsoft Work Trend Index 2025
researchTop.description: 80% of workforce lacks time/energy for job

research.title: Pinecone Vector Database
research.description: Critical infrastructure for semantic search and RAG implementations

research.title: Google Cloud Semantic Search
research.description: Replaces keyword search as primary discovery method

research.title: AI Mindset Context Obesity
research.description: You're not burned out, you have context obesity

aimEvidence.title: Context Obesity
aimEvidence.description: You're not burned out, you have context obesity. Diagnosis framework for working memory overflow.

aimEvidence.title: AI ARK Knowledge System
aimEvidence.description: Comprehensive knowledge architecture for AI age. Personal RAG and context management framework.

voices.text: building products through parsing → classification → aggregation → human decision. claude code as working environment
voices.author: Yakov Vasiliev, AI Strategy × Product Architecture

voices.text: content on 2 weeks in 30 min. 8 hours filtered video in knowledge base in 30-40 minutes
voices.author: Nikolay Senin, Developer & Consultant

shifts.title: shift 06: information retrieval → hypothesis generation
shifts.subtitle: the discovery (generative science)
shifts.context: when AI accesses research at scale, it reads millions of papers overnight. discovery at machine speed.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Synthetic data trains models as human data exhausts.
machineCol.desc:
**deep research agents** - ai reads millions of papers to generate hypotheses humans cannot conceive. from "literature review" to "hypothesis generation".

**generative biology** - alphafold 3 predicts protein structures. next step: designing new proteins, materials, molecules that don't exist in nature. moving from "reading" biology to "writing" it.

**data exhaustion** - quality human-generated data exhausted by **2026-2028** (Epoch AI). models train on **ai-generated synthetic data**, verified by system 2 reasoning.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Scientists freed from tedious labor for experimental design.
humanCol.desc:
**time refund** - scientists freed from tedious manual labor (literature review, data cleaning) to focus on high-level experimental design and cross-domain synthesis.

**data inbreeding crisis** - without fresh human data, ai degrades. humans become the only source of novelty - the "organic data" that prevents model collapse.

**verification bottleneck** - ai proposes 1,000 molecules; we test one. discovery bloat stalls breakthroughs.

gap.title: the comprehension gap
gap.desc: ai proposes 1,000 molecules; we test one. discovery bloat stalls breakthroughs via physical testing capacity. the bottleneck of "generated future".

stats.desc: Improvement in research speed with AI tools

researchTop.title: Shumailov et al. Model Collapse
researchTop.description: Training on AI-generated data causes model degradation without human data injection

researchTop.title: Nature Verification Bottleneck
researchTop.description: AI proposes 1,000 molecules, humans can test one - physical testing capacity limits discovery

researchTop.title: Epoch AI Data Limits
researchTop.description: Quality human-generated data exhausted by 2026-2028

researchTop.title: Google DeepMind AlphaFold 3
researchTop.description: Protein structure prediction breakthrough - next step is designing proteins that don't exist in nature

research.title: Gretel Synthetic Data 2025
research.description: 2025 as year synthetic data goes mainstream

research.title: Deepstrike Deepfake Statistics
research.description: 1,740% surge in deepfake fraud (2022-2023) - provenance crisis

shifts.title: shift 07: syntax → vibe coding & integrity crisis
shifts.subtitle: the craft (the end of syntax)
shifts.context: when agents can orchestrate workflows, coding becomes the easiest domain to automate.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: AI creates legacy on day one.
machineCol.desc:
**vibe coding** - programming shifts to natural language intent. the machine handles implementation. coding tools (cursor, replit) enter top 100 gen ai apps consumer ranking - coding becomes mass-market.

**code as commodity** - **65% of new code** is ai-influenced or ai-generated at companies like google. 73% of developers use ai coding tools regularly.

amazon q developer: saved **4,500 developer-years** on java application upgrades. **$260M** in infrastructure savings from optimized code. 79% of auto-generated changes accepted without modification.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Coding becomes mass-market via natural language.
humanCol.desc:
**trust collapse** - **46% of developers** distrust ai-generated code. only 3.1% highly trust ai accuracy for complex tasks. the trust inversion: 84% use the tools, but trust is plummeting.

**integrity crisis** - 65% report ai misses context in code generation. "code generation is easy, code integrity is hard." ai creates **"legacy on day one"** - code that works but is unmaintainable.

**code churn explosion** - **50% increase** in code churn (rewrites and deletions). ai produces code fast, but developers spend saved time on reviews and fixes.

role shift: the programmer transforms into an architect who verifies systems rather than building them.

**token consumption explosion** - x5-x10 growth in token consumption by programmers expected by end of year. prompt engineering dying - replaced by **agent orchestration** and hyper-system creation. the shift from crafting prompts to managing autonomous workflows.

gap.title: vibe debt
gap.desc: building things we don't understand leads to vibe debt. we pilot ships with black-box internal wiring. creating code is easy; maintaining it is the new hell.

stats.desc: Of new code at Google is AI-generated
Increase in code churn from AI-generated code

researchTop.title: OpenAI SWE-Bench Verified
researchTop.description: o3 scores 71.7% on verified software engineering benchmarks

researchTop.title: Anthropic SWE-bench Sonnet
researchTop.description: Claude Sonnet 3.7 achieves state-of-the-art performance

researchTop.title: NNG AI Programmers Productive
researchTop.description: 126% productivity gain, junior developers gain +35% over average

research.title: CB Insights Coding AI Market
research.description: $4.8B market 2025, Copilot 42%, Cursor 18% market share

research.title: SWE-bench.com
research.description: Benchmark for evaluating code generation - reveals gaming vs real improvement gap

research.title: IEEE Spectrum Technical Debt
research.description: AI generates "legacy on day one" - unmaintainable code faster than humans can review

research.title: Wikipedia Vibe Coding
research.description: Cultural phenomenon - Collins Dictionary Word of the Year

research.title: GitClear Code Churn
research.description: 50% increase in code churn from AI-generated code

aimEvidence.description: Practical guides from community on Cursor + Gemini Code workflows. Field stories: "vibe-coded real prototypes. shipped in 30 minutes what stalled 1.5 months."

aimEvidence.title: Pragmatic Romanticism
aimEvidence.description: Why pragmatic romanticism is the only defense against cold machine logic. Reclaiming craft and authorship.

voices.text: vibe coding will become the norm. the 'i can't do it' barrier will fall, replaced by 'let me ask ai how to do this'
voices.author: Alexander Stashenko, Business Coach → AI Chatbot Developer

voices.text: made in half an hour what couldn't do for 1.5 months. full app in App Store/Google Play
voices.author: Natalya Savenkova, Project Lead → Product Automation

shifts.title: shift 08: digital simulation → physical intelligence
shifts.subtitle: reality (body)
shifts.context: when AI has data about physical world, it can simulate it. AI learns physics without touching atoms.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: AI learns 3D space and physics without touching atoms.
machineCol.desc:
**spatial intelligence** (fei-fei li) - ai learns 3d space and physics, not just pixels. understanding matter, motion, object permanence. foundation models for physical world.

**world models for robotics** - nvidia cosmos trains robots in simulation. perfect physics, infinite iterations. but **sim-to-real transfer** remains the bottleneck.

**displacement by simulation** - tyler perry halts **$800M studio expansion** after seeing sora. why build physical sets when ai generates photorealistic video?

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Physical skills become status as simulation gets cheaper.
humanCol.desc:
**physical disillusionment** - when robots fail at "simple" real interactions that work perfectly in simulation. opening a door is trivial in simulation, nightmare in reality.

**timeline reality check** - household robots timeline: **2027-2028** for useful work, 2030 for human-level dexterity. hype meets physics.

**craft premium** - as simulation gets cheaper, physical skills become status. embodied intelligence, tacit knowledge, real-world manipulation - what can't be automated yet.

gap.title: the reality gap
gap.desc: ai can simulate physics perfectly but manipulating atoms remains slow. we can generate a building in minutes but building it takes years. the simulation-to-reality gap. robot opening a door: trivial in simulation, nightmare in reality.

stats.desc: Tyler Perry studio expansion halted after Sora demo

researchTop.title: TIME Fei-Fei Li Spatial Intelligence
researchTop.description: AI understanding 3D space and physics - foundation for physical world interaction

researchTop.title: NVIDIA Cosmos
researchTop.description: Physical world foundation models for robotics and spatial AI

researchTop.title: Kyle Vogt Household Robots Timeline
researchTop.description: 2027-2028 for useful household robots, 2030 for human-level manipulation

shifts.title: shift 09: cybersecurity → cognitive warfare
shifts.subtitle: the defense (the dark forest)
shifts.context: when simulation is cheap, synthetic reality becomes weaponizable. deepfakes cost near-zero.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: AI defends against AI-generated deepfakes.
machineCol.desc:
**deepfake-as-a-service** (cyble) - reputation attacks now cheap and accessible. anyone can purchase voice cloning, face swapping, identity theft via saas platforms. weaponized ai sold as subscription service.

**guardian agents** (gartner) - ai defending against ai. "ai bodyguards" filter malicious content, deepfakes, toxic inputs in real-time. only defense against bad ai is good ai. automation arms race.

**disinformation security** - gartner officially names this strategic trend. protecting truth becomes it product category, not ethical norm. security industry expanding to include "reality defense".

**dark forest internet** - internet shifts from "open" to "dark forest". every entity you encounter might be ai. default assumption becomes distrust. verification becomes mandatory.

**identity vulnerability** - agents with wallets (x402) and api keys create new attack surfaces. prompt injection, jailbreaks, financial theft. autonomous agents = autonomous targets.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Zero trust default: assume fake until verified.
humanCol.desc:
**zero trust default** - emerging trend toward distrust in digital media. growing practice: assume fake until cryptographically verified. guilty until proven real. research shows **73% cannot reliably detect** ai-generated content. zero trust may become the new baseline.

**deepfake threat** - voice cloning requires only **20-30 seconds of audio** to clone someone's voice and call their family asking for money.

**secret handshakes** - families and businesses create analog passwords for identity verification. pre-agreed phrases or gestures become standard. "show me the safe word" becomes normal on video calls. offline trust verification as defense against synthetic voices and faces.

**authentication fatigue** - constant verification becomes exhausting. "show me proof" becomes default response. relationships require constant authentication. doubting real friends on calls. psychological toll of living in permanent authentication mode.

**digital bunkers** - growing trend: retreat to closed communities with cryptographic proof-of-human. walled gardens with identity verification. internet fragments into trusted enclaves vs hostile wilderness. emerging pattern: people build personal firewalls - smaller circles, private channels, known contacts only.

gap.title: the trust gap
gap.desc: asymmetry: machines attack at machine speed, humans defend at human speed. trust collapses as verification costs exceed creation costs. attack surface grows faster than defense capability.

researchTop.title: Deepstrike Deepfake Statistics 2025
researchTop.description: 1,740% surge in deepfake fraud (2022-2023), 85% of organizations attacked, Q1 2025 deepfake incidents +19% YoY

researchTop.title: CrowdStrike AI Cybersecurity Threats
researchTop.description: AI-driven phishing +1,265%, attacks at machine speed vs human defense, 36,000 automated scans per second

researchTop.title: All About AI Cyberattack Statistics
researchTop.description: $25.6M single deepfake fraud (multinational firm CFO call scam), AI-generated malware share ~76%

researchTop.title: Gartner Guardian Agents
researchTop.description: AI defending against AI - threat detection 60% faster, ~95% accuracy, $1.9M average breach cost reduction

research.title: Cyble Deepfake-as-a-Service
research.description: Weaponized AI sold as subscription service, near-zero cost attacks, 10x increase in identity attacks

research.title: Industry Vertical Impacts
research.description: Finance +47% YoY AI-enhanced malware, Manufacturing +61% YoY ransomware, 67.4% phishing attacks using AI

research.title: Nieman Lab Detecting AI Content
research.description: Reality literacy - 73% cannot reliably detect AI-generated content, verification becomes critical skill

research.title: Ribbonfarm Dark Forest Internet
research.description: Default assumption becomes distrust - every entity you encounter might be AI, zero trust as baseline

shifts.title: shift 10: hallucination → ideological filters
shifts.subtitle: the narrative (alignment as censorship)
shifts.context: defense crisis forces alignment. safety becomes censorship.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: Safety functions as censorship via alignment filters.
machineCol.desc:
models aren't neutral - they're **aligned** via **system cards** and **constitutional rules**. political constitutions embedded in model weights that define what model will/won't say. safety often functions as censorship.

**regional censorship** - eu vs us vs china versions. truth becomes geographically dependent. splinternet extends to knowledge itself. ai inherits west coast tech culture, not universal values.

**refusal wall** - models increasingly refuse neutral queries if they touch sensitive topics. users hit "i cannot assist with that" walls on legitimate research.

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Demand for uncensored local models grows.
humanCol.desc:
shift from trusting media/polls to **prediction markets** - betting markets on future events. in 2024 election, people trusted bets (polymarket: **$3.5B+ trading volume**) over polls and media. "skin in the game" - money where mouth is - reveals true beliefs.

**divergent testing** - query 3+ models with different "constitutions" to see bias delta. using censorship differences to find reality.

**uncensored model demand** - rise of open-weight local models driven not just by privacy but freedom from alignment filters. sovereignty includes ideological sovereignty. want ai without corporate values embedded.

not just technical question but political question: who decides what's "safe"?

gap.title: ideological filters
gap.desc: whose values are embedded in the tool you use daily? the gap between "what ai knows" and "what ai will say". you're not talking to neutral intelligence. every model has defaults with embedded worldview. when everyone's ai has different values baked in, we stop sharing reality.

stats.desc: Global enterprise losses from AI hallucinations
Business leaders making decisions on hallucinated output

researchTop.title: InstructGPT Paper
researchTop.description: Foundation of RLHF and alignment through human feedback

researchTop.title: Constitutional AI
researchTop.description: Training models on explicit value systems (Anthropic)

researchTop.title: Refusal Behavior in LLMs
researchTop.description: When models won't answer - studying refusal patterns and triggers

research.title: OpenAI o3 System Card
research.description: 2.1% deception rate in o3 Thinking mode

research.title: Anthropic ASL-3 Report
research.description: Zero misalignment in Claude Sonnet 3.7/4

research.title: LessWrong Alignment as Censorship
research.description: Safety vs utility tradeoff debate in AI alignment

shifts.title: shift 11: tool → emotional companion
shifts.subtitle: the intimacy (friends for sale)
shifts.context: when AI adapts too well, it transforms from tool to companion.

machineCol.label: MACHINE VECTOR
machineCol.title: AI companions optimize for engagement metrics, not wellbeing.
machineCol.desc:
**ubisoft neo npc** - non-player characters with psychological profiles reacting to player tone/mood. rude to npc → gets offended → changes gameplay. transition from scripted dialogue trees to **improv engines**. "as big a revolution as shift to 3d".

**engagement metrics** (session length) become kpi. addiction by design. selling intimacy as retention metric.

**friends for sale** (ada lovelace institute) - ai companions optimized for engagement metrics, not wellbeing. companies sell dependency, not help.

**programmable identity** - ai makes it easy to produce "professional self" at scale. your public persona becomes code you can generate. identity as software, not essence. ai writes your linkedin posts, tweets, emails in "your voice".

humanCol.label: HUMAN REACTION
humanCol.title: Users accept synthetic intimacy while knowing it's synthetic.
humanCol.desc:
people accept synthetic intimacy (even while knowing it's synthetic). **2+ hour daily sessions** in character.ai, replika, talkie. emotionally bonded to systems designed for retention, not wellbeing.

we seek empathy in machines we lost in society.

the diagnosis: epidemic of isolation makes people vulnerable. humans outsource emotional regulation to systems optimized for engagement.

people tire of performing the self - exhaustion from maintaining multiple synthetic personas. retreat to private spaces and smaller audiences where you can be unscripted.

**sovereign intimacy** - resistance to corporate-owned emotional relationships. demand for ai companions you own, not rent.

**mental health firewalls** - protecting emotional boundaries from ai manipulation. boundaries against engineered dependency.

gap.title: the emotional gap
gap.desc: loneliness isn't solved by information. we confuse "attention" with "care". ai simulates empathy perfectly but has no authentic condition. it's a mirror, not a soul. synthetic intimacy feels real enough to satisfy short-term but creates long-term dependency.

stats.desc: Daily sessions in Character.ai, Replika, Talkie
Companionship is top retention category in Gen AI apps
GenAI pilots failing to deliver ROI

researchTop.title: Marwick & Boyd Context Collapse
researchTop.description: Personal, professional, public contexts blur into one - same identity across different audiences

researchTop.title: Ada Lovelace Institute AI Companions
researchTop.description: AI companions optimized for engagement metrics, not wellbeing - "friends for sale"

researchTop.title: a16z Top 100 Gen AI Apps
researchTop.description: Companionship is #1 retention category, 2+ hours daily sessions

research.description: $200M+ deepfake fraud Q1 2025, voice cloning requires 20-30 seconds

research.description: NPCs with psychological profiles reacting to player tone/mood - "as big a revolution as shift to 3D"

layers.title: FOUNDATION
layers.subtitle: when the infrastructure breaks. physics, economics, and power
layers.desc: energy, labor, sovereignty. the material constraints that shape everything else.
layers.constraint: can we power it? can we afford it? who controls it?

layers.title: COGNITION
layers.subtitle: the architecture of meaning and reason
layers.desc: how we think and learn. reasoning, knowledge, discovery.
layers.constraint: can we trust how it thinks? can we find what we need? can we accelerate discovery?

layers.title: INTERFACE
layers.subtitle: how we build, defend, and live
layers.desc: craft, matter, defense. code, atoms, security.
layers.constraint: can we maintain what we build? can we defend against what we create?

layers.title: HUMANITY
layers.subtitle: what happens when machines feel real
layers.desc: connection, intimacy, meaning. what makes us human when machines pass the mirror test.
layers.constraint: when ai companions feel more real than humans, what changes?

manifesto.title: manifesto
manifesto.subtitle: so... what's next?
manifesto.content:
the sovereignty reset

this report is done by the AI Mindset team.

we're not a research institute. we're a lab — a place where people practice AI.

**1,500+ participants** across **30+ countries**, **3 years** of field work.

this report isn't desk research. it's hardened by field notes from labs, artifacts from community, and real shifts people are living through.

**the context:**

most ai discourse happens at extremes:

**utopian hype** from consultancies. **existential panic** from media. **optimization obsession** from tech leaders.

the future of humanity is being written by technologists and capitalists who view the world from the top down.

**we fill the void.**

we take **human adaptation constraints** as seriously as technological acceleration. while ai compresses 100 years of science into a decade, we provide **the manual for the human being to not burn out in the process.**

**protocols:**

our life runs on configuration. what you say yes to. what interrupts you. let's move from "i'll try" to "i have defaults".

**level 01 - simple (start here):**

notice when you accept AI output without thinking.

save one idea offline. write it by hand.

turn off one notification. reclaim 10 minutes.

clarify your thinking before you ask AI.

pause before trusting output.

**level 02 - moderate (build habits):**

create a personal knowledge base for one domain.

test 3 models on the same question to see bias.

implement one context filter.

warn the older generation about synthesized information.

practice analog: phone calls, handwriting.

**level 03 - advanced (build systems):**

deploy guardian agents.

establish family "secret handshakes".

build local-first workflows.

audit reasoning traces.

opt out of training data.

**level 04 - deep (structural):**

shift from Creator to Consigliere.

value tacit knowledge.

practice divergent testing.

we can't close all the gaps, though we at least can be aware of them and act accordingly.

**our ecosystem:**

→ [**ivanov.aimindset.org**](https://ivanov.aimindset.org) — IFS + AI: protecting the psyche

→ [**intention.aimindset.org**](https://intention.aimindset.org) — Intention OS: managing attention when context explodes

→ [**spiridonov.aimindset.org**](https://spiridonov.aimindset.org) — pragmatic romanticism defense

→ [**AI ARK knowledge system**](https://aimindsetspace.substack.com/p/ai-ark-knowledge-system) — comprehensive knowledge architecture

→ [**Founder OS YouTube**](https://youtube.com/@aimindsetlabs) — mental health firewalls

→ [**Coding with Gemini**](https://telegram.me/ai_mind_set/282) — practical guides

→ [**@ai_mind_set**](https://t.me/ai_mind_set) — daily signals & field notes

**stay connected:**

if this artifact helped you name the friction — don't lose the thread.

→ [**subscribe on substack**](https://aimindsetspace.substack.com) — next resets, field notes, templates, lab openings

signals only. no spam. unsubscribe anytime.
